bcl:subrule.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant means an affidavit referred to in Rule 25-3 (2) (g);
affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing means an affidavit referred to in Rule 25-6 (2) (g);

alternate executor means a person who, under the terms of a will, is to become an executor if the person named in the will as executor is unable or unwilling to act or continue to act in that capacity;
authorization to obtain estate information means an authorization to obtain estate information issued under Rule 25-4 (1) (a);
authorization to obtain resealing information means an authorization to obtain resealing information issued under Rule 25-7 (1) (a);
citor means a person who serves a citation under Rule 25-11 (1);
deliver, in relation to a person, means provide to the person by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: personal delivery,
ordinary mail to the person's residential or postal address, or
e-mail, fax or other electronic means to the address provided by the person for that purpose;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: disputant means a person who files a notice of dispute under Rule 25-10 (1);
estate grant means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a grant of probate, whether the grant is made for general, special or limited purposes,
a grant of administration, whether the grant is made for general, special or limited purposes, or
an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: executor means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person named in a will as an executor, or
if 2 or more persons are named in a will as an executor, each of those co-executors,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: unless that person has renounced executorship;
physical will means a written will that is not in electronic form;
renounce executorship has the meaning set out in subrule (4) of this rule;
solemn form has the meaning set out in subrule (5) of this rule;
submission for estate grant means a submission for estate grant in Form P2;
submission for resealing means a submission for resealing in Form P21;
subscribing witness includes a witness who subscribes a will while in the electronic presence of the will-maker;
testamentary document means a document that does one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: makes or purports to make a testamentary disposition other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a designation under Part 5 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, or
a designation of a beneficiary under Part 3 or 4 of the Insurance Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: appoints or purports to appoint an executor of the estate of the maker of the document,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: and, without limiting this, includes a will;
third-party electronic repository means an electronic repository that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: used to store an electronic will, and
maintained by a person other than the will-maker;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: wills notice means a notice filed under section 73 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act with the chief executive officer under the Vital Statistics Act.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The definitions and interpretation sections of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act apply to this Part unless the context otherwise requires.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: When delivery occurs under this Part
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Delivery of a document under this Part occurs as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to Rule 25-2 (5) (a), if the document is sent for delivery to a person by ordinary mail, the document is deemed to be delivered one week later on the same day of the week as the day of mailing or, if that deemed day of delivery is a Saturday or holiday, on the next day that is not a Saturday or holiday;

subject to Rule 25-2 (5) (b), (6) and (7), if the document is transmitted for delivery to a person by e-mail, fax or other electronic means to the e-mail, fax or other electronic address provided by the person for that purpose,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the document is transmitted before 4 p.m. on a day that is not a Saturday or holiday, the document is deemed to be delivered on the day of transmission, or
if the document is transmitted on a Saturday or holiday, or after 4 p.m. on any other day, the document is deemed to be delivered on the next day that is not a Saturday or holiday.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An executor renounces executorship

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in a circumstance set out in paragraph (a) or (b) of Rule 25-11 (5), or
when a notice of renunciation in Form P17 from the executor is filed

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: with documents filed under Rule 25-3 (2) in relation to the will in which the executor was named as an executor, or
in the proceeding in which the documents referred to in subparagraph (i) were filed.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A will is proved in solemn form when, after a trial or hearing, the court pronounces for the force and validity of the will in solemn form of law.

Unless a contrary intention appears in this Part or in an order under Rule 25-14 (8) (b), a reference to a party or party of record in a rule of these Supreme Court Civil Rules is, for the purposes of applying that rule to a proceeding under this Part, deemed to be a reference to a person who has filed a document in the proceeding.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Electronic wills — originals and digital reproductions
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Part,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an electronic will is deemed to be in its original electronic form if the will is in the electronic form in which it was first saved after being signed, and
a document is a digital reproduction of an electronic will if the will is in an electronic form other than its original electronic form.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Applications for estate grant or resealing
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Unless the court otherwise orders, a person intending to apply for either of the following must comply with the requirements of this rule:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an estate grant;
the resealing of a foreign grant in relation to the estate of a deceased.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of proposed application in relation to estate
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person intending to bring an application referred to in subrule (1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver the following documents to the persons referred to in subrule (2):

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a notice of proposed application in relation to estate in Form P1;
if the intended applicant intends to apply for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed, a copy of the will in relation to which the application is to be made;

if the intended applicant intends to apply for the resealing of a foreign grant or for an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, a copy of the foreign grant and, if a copy of the will in relation to which the foreign grant was issued is not attached to the foreign grant, a copy of the will;
if the intended applicant intends to apply for an ancillary grant of administration without will annexed, a copy of the foreign grant, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the intended applicant is required to deliver a copy of a will under paragraph (a) (i) or (ii) and the will is an electronic will, the recipient of the notice is entitled to the will within 7 days after delivering a demand for the will in its original electronic form in Form P46.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Recipient of notice entitled to will in original electronic form
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A recipient of a notice described in subrule (1.1) (a) (i) is entitled to either

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: receive the will in its original electronic form, or
receive access to the will in its original electronic form, if the original electronic will is stored only at a secure online location.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Demand for will in original electronic form
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A notice recipient's right to the will or right to access under subrule (1.2) may be exercised by delivering a demand for the will in its original electronic form in Form P46.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Provision of will in original electronic form
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An applicant must provide the will in its original electronic form or provide access to the will in its original electronic form within 7 days of receiving a demand in Form P46.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Persons to whom documents must be delivered
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The documents referred to in subrule (1) must be delivered to the following persons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the deceased left a will, each of the following who is not a person by whom or on whose behalf the documents referred to in subrule (1) are to be delivered (a person by whom or on whose behalf the documents referred to in subrule (1) are to be delivered is, in this subrule, called an "intended applicant"):

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: each person

bcl:clause.bcl:text: who is named in the will as executor or alternate executor,
whose right to make an application for an estate grant in relation to the deceased is prior to or equal to the intended applicant's right to make that application, and
who is alive at the time of the deceased's death;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: each beneficiary under the will who is not referred to in subparagraph (i) of this paragraph;
each person

bcl:clause.bcl:text: who, under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, would have been an intestate successor if the deceased did not leave a will and the estate exceeded the preferential share of the spouse as described in section 21 (2) to (5) of that Act, and
who is not referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii) of this paragraph;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the Attorney General, if the government is entitled, under section 3 of the Escheat Act, to all or part of the estate of the deceased;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the deceased did not leave a will,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: either

bcl:clause.bcl:text: each person who, under Division 1 of Part 3 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, is an intestate successor of the deceased or would have been an intestate successor if the estate exceeded the preferential share of the spouse as described in section 21 (2) to (5) of that Act, or
if there is no such person, the Attorney General, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: each creditor of the deceased whose claim exceeds $10 000 and who is not referred to in subparagraph (i) (A) of this paragraph;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the deceased was a Nisg̱a'a citizen, the Nisg̱a'a Lisims government;
if the deceased was a member of a treaty first nation, the treaty first nation;
any other person who, by court order under subrule (14) (a), is to receive notice;
any person not referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) of this subrule who has served a citation on the intended applicant in relation to the deceased.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person may not make an application referred to in subrule (1) until at least 21 days after the date on which the person delivers the notice and other applicable materials referred to in subrule (1.1).
A notice under subrule (1) must be in Form P1, must be signed by the intended applicant or the intended applicant's lawyer and must contain the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name, last residential address and date of death of the deceased;

subject to subrule (4), the name and mailing address of the intended applicant and an address for service for the intended applicant, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1);
if the intended applicant is an individual, the city and country in which the intended applicant ordinarily lives;
the estate grant or resealing for which the intended applicant intends to apply;
the registry of the court where the submission for estate grant or submission for resealing will be filed;
the following statements in relation to each person to whom the notice is delivered:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the person has a right to oppose,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: in the case of a notice provided in relation to an application for an estate grant, the issuance to the intended applicant of either or both of an authorization to obtain estate information and an estate grant, or

in the case of a notice provided in relation to an application for a resealing of a foreign grant, either or both of the issuance of an authorization to obtain resealing information and the resealing of the foreign grant;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the person may or may not be entitled to claim against the estate for relief, including a claim under

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the Family Law Act, or
Division 6 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that, if the person chooses to take a step referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii) of this paragraph, the person must do so within the time limited by any relevant rule of court or other enactment;
that the person may consult with that person's own lawyer concerning the person's interest in, or rights against, the estate;

in the case of an application for a grant of administration, that the person may apply for an order requiring the intended applicant to provide security unless the intended applicant is the Public Guardian and Trustee;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the following statements:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that an estate grant may issue or a foreign grant may be resealed, as the case may be, without further notice, on any date that is at least 21 days after the date on which the notice is delivered, or on any earlier date ordered by the court;

if an authorization to obtain estate information issues to the intended applicant, the intended applicant may apply for an estate grant without further notice, and if an authorization to obtain resealing information issues to the intended applicant, the intended applicant may apply for the resealing of the foreign grant without further notice;

that if an estate grant issues to the intended applicant as a result of the application, the intended applicant must provide, if there is a will, to the beneficiaries or, if there is no will, to intestate successors of the deceased, an accounting as to how the estate was administered and how the estate assets were distributed, and

that if a foreign grant is resealed as a result of the application, the intended applicant must provide, if there is a will, to the beneficiaries or, if there is no will, to intestate successors of the deceased, an accounting as to how the estate comprising the assets to which the resealed grant applies was administered and how those assets were distributed;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the will to which the notice relates does not contain a visible signature, the reasons why there is no visible signature.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application referred to in subrule (1) is to be brought by 2 or more intended applicants, those intended applicants

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must adopt a single address for service that is applicable to them all, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and
may adopt additional addresses for service under Rule 4-1 (2) provided that each additional address for service is applicable to all of the applicants.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: When delivery occurs under this rule
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Delivery of a document under this rule occurs as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the document is sent for delivery to a person by ordinary mail to the person's mailing address, the document is deemed to be delivered on the date it is mailed;

subject to subrules (6) and (7) of this rule, if the document is transmitted for delivery to a person by e-mail, fax or other electronic means to the e-mail, fax or other electronic address provided by the person for that purpose, the document is deemed to be delivered on the date it is transmitted.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: No delivery by e-mail, fax or other electronic means without acknowledgement
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Sending a document referred to in subrule (1) to a person by e-mail, fax or other electronic means does not constitute delivery of the document to that person unless that person provides a written acknowledgement of receipt.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If delivery is effected by e-mail, fax or other electronic means
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If documents referred to in subrule (1) are delivered by e-mail, fax or other electronic means, the intended applicant must swear, in an affidavit in Form P9, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the intended recipient of the documents has, in writing, acknowledged receipt of those documents, and

the intended applicant will retain a copy of that acknowledgement until the personal representative of the deceased is discharged and, until then, will produce that acknowledgement promptly after being requested to do so by the registrar.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If person to whom notice is to be delivered is a minor
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a person to whom documents are to be delivered under subrule (1) is a minor, the intended applicant must deliver those documents

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the applicant knows that the minor resides with all of the minor's parents, to those parents;
if subparagraph (i) does not apply but the applicant knows that a parent or guardian has responsibility for financial decisions relating to the minor, to that parent or guardian;
if neither subparagraph (i) nor subparagraph (ii) applies but the applicant knows of one or more addresses at which the minor resides, to the minor at each of those addresses, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subrule (9), to the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An intended applicant need not deliver documents under subrule (8) (b) to the Public Guardian and Trustee if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the intended applicant is an executor or alternate executor of the deceased's estate,
the minor is not a spouse or child of the deceased, and
the deceased's will

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: creates a trust for the interest of the minor in the estate, and
appoints a trustee for that trust.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If person to whom notice is to be delivered is a mentally incompetent person
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subrule (11) applies if, in respect of a person to whom documents are to be delivered under subrule (1),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one of the following is appointed for the person:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a committee as defined in the Patients Property Act;
a person outside British Columbia acting in a similar capacity as a committee under the Patients Property Act, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is or may be mentally incompetent and no committee or person has been appointed as described in paragraph (a).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How notice may be delivered to a mentally incompetent person
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If subrule (10) applies to a person to whom documents are to be delivered under subrule (1), the intended applicant must deliver the documents to the person as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if subrule (10) (a) (i) applies, by delivering the documents to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the committee referred to in that subparagraph, and
the Public Guardian and Trustee;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if subrule (10) (a) (ii) applies, by delivering the documents to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the equivalent person referred to in that subparagraph, and
the Public Guardian and Trustee;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if subrule (10) (b) applies, by delivering the documents to the Public Guardian and Trustee in addition to delivering those documents to the person.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If person to whom notice is to be delivered is dead
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a person to whom documents are to be delivered under subrule (1) is dead, the intended applicant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver those documents to the personal representative of the person, if known, or

if the intended applicant does not know of a personal representative of the person, apply to the court under Rule 8-4 for directions and, unless the court dispenses with notice, deliver those documents in accordance with the order obtained on that application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Notice to Public Guardian and Trustee
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: At the time that a notice is delivered to the Public Guardian and Trustee under subrule (8) or (11), the intended applicant must also deliver to the Public Guardian and Trustee a notice, in writing, setting out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of every other person to whom notice is required to be delivered under subrule (8) or (11), and
the most recent of each of the following that is known to the intended applicant about each of those persons:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person's residential address, inside or outside British Columbia;
the person's postal address, inside or outside British Columbia;
the person's e-mail address;
the person's fax number.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Court may alter or dispense with notice
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: On application, the court may do one or both of the following to avoid any prejudice that would otherwise result to the intended applicant, to another person or to the estate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: vary the classes of persons to whom documents referred to in subrule (1) are to be delivered;
dispense with the requirement under subrule (1), (8) or (11) to deliver documents to one or more persons other than the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Public Guardian and Trustee not required to deliver notice under subrule (1)
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the intended applicant is the Public Guardian and Trustee, he or she is not required to deliver documents under subrule (1) to any person referred to in subrule (2) except that the Public Guardian and Trustee must deliver the documents to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the deceased left a will, each spouse or child of the deceased;
if the deceased was a Nisg̱a'a citizen, the Nisg̱a'a Lisims government or, if the deceased was a member of a treaty first nation, the treaty first nation.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If application made for solemn form grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person may file the materials required for an application under this Part without first providing notice under this rule to a person referred to in subrule (2) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the application is for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed in relation to a will that has been proved in solemn form, and
the person referred to in subrule (2) was served with the petition or notice of application under which proof of the will in solemn form was sought.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: In this rule, will means,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to an application for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed, the testamentary document in relation to which the application was brought, or
in relation to an application for an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, the testamentary document in relation to which the foreign grant was issued.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Documents to be filed in an application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person wishing to apply for an estate grant must, after delivering in accordance with Rule 25-2 the documents that were required to be delivered under that rule, file the following documents:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a submission for estate grant in Form P2;
an affidavit from the applicant, or, if there are 2 or more applicants, from at least one of the applicants, as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the application is for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: in Form P3 if subrule (6) of this rule applies, or
in Form P4 if subrule (6) of this rule does not apply;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the application is for a grant of administration without will annexed, in Form P5;
if the application is for an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, in Form P6;
if the application is for an ancillary grant of administration without will annexed, in Form P7;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if there are 2 or more applicants, an affidavit in Form P8 from each of the applicants who has not sworn an affidavit referred to in paragraph (b);
two copies of a certificate from the chief executive officer under the Vital Statistics Act indicating the results of a search for a wills notice filed by or on behalf of the deceased;
any affidavit or material required by any of subrules (15) to (24) of this rule;

one or more affidavits, in Form P9, that, collectively, confirm that the documents referred to in Rule 25-2 were delivered to all of the persons to whom, under that rule, the documents were required to be delivered;

in accordance with subrule (7) of this rule, from the applicant, or, if there is more than one applicant, from at least one of the applicants, an affidavit of assets and liabilities, which affidavit must be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, an affidavit of assets and liabilities for domiciled estate grant in Form P10, or
if subrule (8) applies, an affidavit of assets and liabilities for domiciled estate grant in Form P10 or an affidavit of assets and liabilities for non-domiciled estate grant in Form P11;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in accordance with subrule (10), for each of the documents that are filed with the submission for estate grant and that are not written in the English language, an affidavit of translator in Form P12;
if one or more of the executors has renounced executorship, whichever of the following that applies:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the executor has provided to the applicant a notice of renunciation in Form P17, that notice of renunciation;

if the executor is deemed under Rule 25-11 to have renounced executorship, an affidavit of deemed renunciation in Form P34 prepared by the citor under Rule 25-11 (7) and any supporting affidavits of service;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any document required under subrule (3).

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (5), the person wishing to apply for an estate grant must file with the documents referred to in subrule (2) (a) to (j) the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application will be for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed, and if the will related to the application is a physical will, the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of a physical will that was made when witnesses were present,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: subject to clause (B), the originally signed version of the will,
if the originally signed version of the will does not exist or is not available, a physical copy or a copy saved in Portable Document Format (PDF), and
2 additional copies of the will;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of a physical will that was signed in counterparts when witnesses were electronically present,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: subject to clause (B), the originals of each of the signed and witnessed counterparts,
if one of the originals referred to in clause (A) does not exist or is not available, a copy of the counterpart, and
2 copies of the counterparts signed by the will-maker and 2 copies of the last page of each counterpart that was signed by the witnesses;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if an order has been made that affects the validity or content of the will and that order has not yet been filed in the proceeding within which the estate grant is being sought, a copy of that order;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application will be for a grant of probate or grant of administration with will annexed and the will related to the application is an electronic will, the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: subject to subparagraphs (ii) to (iv), the signed will in its original electronic form, if that original exists or, if that original does not exist or is not available, a digital reproduction or physical copy of the will;
if the original electronic form of a will was saved in PDF, the will in that format;
if the original electronic will was not first saved in PDF,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a physical copy, or a copy saved in PDF,
an affidavit in Form P4, and
an affidavit in Form P45;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of an electronic will that is maintained in a third-party electronic repository,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: a physical copy, or a copy saved in PDF,
an affidavit in Form P4,
an affidavit in Form P45, and
information about how the third-party electronic repository can be accessed for the purpose of viewing the will;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if an order has been made that affects the validity or content of the electronic will and that order has not yet been filed in the proceeding within which the estate grant is being sought, a copy of that order;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a grant of probate or equivalent, or a grant of administration with will annexed or equivalent, was issued in a jurisdiction that has not been prescribed for the purposes of section 138 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act and the application under this Part will be for an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a copy of the foreign grant that has been certified by the issuing court;
if the will is not attached to the foreign grant, a copy of the will that has been certified by the issuing court;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a grant of administration without will annexed, or equivalent, was issued in a jurisdiction that has not been prescribed for the purposes of section 138 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act and the application will be for an ancillary grant of administration without will annexed, a copy of the foreign grant certified by the court out of which the grant of administration without will annexed, or equivalent, was issued.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application for an estate grant is brought by 2 or more applicants, those applicants

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must adopt a single address for service that is applicable to them all, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and
may adopt additional addresses for service under Rule 4-1 (2) provided that each additional address for service is applicable to all of the applicants.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: None of the documents referred to in a paragraph of subrule (2) or (3) may be attached to any document referred to in any other paragraph of subrule (2) or (3), and, without limiting this, an originally signed version of a physical will, when submitted for filing in accordance with subrule (3) (a), must not be attached to any other document.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Form of affidavit for application for grant of probate or grant of administration with will annexed
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The affidavit required of an applicant under subrule (2) (b) in relation to an application for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed may be in Form P3 if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant swearing the affidavit is named in the will as an executor or alternate executor or is a person referred to in section 131 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,
the applicant swearing the affidavit is satisfied that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a diligent search for a testamentary document of the deceased has been made in each place that could reasonably be considered to be a place where a testamentary document may be found, including, without limitation, in all places where the deceased usually kept his or her documents, and
no testamentary document that is dated later than the date of the will has been found,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant swearing the affidavit believes that the will is the last will of the deceased that deals with property in British Columbia,

the will complies with the requirements of Division 1 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, and the originally signed version of the will is being filed with the submission for estate grant,

a certificate has been obtained from the chief executive officer under the Vital Statistics Act indicating the results of a search for a wills notice filed by or on behalf of the deceased, and the certificate indicates that no wills notice has been filed by or on behalf of the deceased

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in relation to a testamentary document that is dated later than the date of the will, or
at all,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant is not requesting that the will be recognized as a military will executed in accordance with the requirements of section 38 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,
the applicant swearing the affidavit is not aware of there being any issues respecting execution of the will,
the applicant swearing the affidavit is not aware of there being any interlineations, erasures or obliterations in, or other alterations to, the will,
the applicant swearing the affidavit is not aware of there being any issues arising from the appearance of the will,
any documents referred to in the will are attached to the will, and

the applicant swearing the affidavit is not aware of there being any grant of probate or administration, or equivalent, having been issued, in relation to the deceased, in British Columbia or in any other jurisdiction.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The affidavit required under subrule (2) (g) may be filed concurrently with or subsequent to the filing of the other documents referred to in subrules (2) and (3).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Affidavit of assets and liabilities for non-domiciled estate grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The applicant for an estate grant may file an affidavit of assets and liabilities for non-domiciled estate grant in Form P11 if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the deceased was not domiciled or ordinarily resident in British Columbia at the time of death,
all property of the deceased situated outside British Columbia, if any, has been, is being or will be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: administered by a foreign personal representative, or
otherwise administered under the law of a foreign jurisdiction.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Whether or not an estate grant has been issued in response to an application for an estate grant, if the applicant determines, after filing the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant required in relation to the application, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: there are assets or liabilities of the estate that are not referred to in that affidavit or in an affidavit filed under this subrule, or

information contained in the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant or in a supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant filed under this subrule is incorrect or incomplete,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the applicant must, promptly after making that determination,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file a supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for domiciled estate grant in Form P14 or, if the applicant has filed in the proceeding an affidavit of assets and liabilities for non-domiciled estate grant in Form P11, a supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for non-domiciled estate grant in Form P15, and
pay all fees payable in relation to that filing, including all applicable probate fees.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An affidavit of translator in Form P12 must be filed concurrently with any document referred to in subrule (2) or (3) that is the subject of a translation.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Delivery to Public Guardian and Trustee
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (12) of this rule, if, under Rule 25-2, the applicant was required to deliver to the Public Guardian and Trustee the documents referred to in Rule 25-2 (1), the applicant must, promptly after filing a document referred to in subrule (2) or (9) of this rule, deliver a copy of that filed document to the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Exceptions to delivery to Public Guardian and Trustee
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An applicant referred to in subrule (11) need not, under that subrule, deliver to the Public Guardian and Trustee the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of any document filed under subrule (3) if a copy of that document was delivered to the Public Guardian and Trustee under Rule 25-2;
the exhibits to the affidavits of delivery filed under subrule (2) (f) of this rule;
any affidavit of delivery filed under subrule (2) (f) that relates solely to delivery of the notice of proposed application to the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the Public Guardian and Trustee is the applicant in an application brought under this rule, the Public Guardian and Trustee may, by filing a direction in Form P13, direct that the court file respecting the application and any related material specified by the Public Guardian and Trustee be sealed, and, in that event, the registrar must seal the court file and related material in the manner, to the extent and for the period set out in section 125 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act.
The applicant in an application brought under this rule must swear or affirm in the affidavit required under subrule (2) (b) that the applicant is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a diligent search for a testamentary document of the deceased has been made in each place that could reasonably be considered to be a place where a testamentary document may be found, including, without limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in all places where the deceased usually kept his or her documents,
on electronic devices or in third-party electronic repositories used by the deceased,
at a location specified in the certificate referred to in subrule (2) (d), and

if that certificate indicates that the testamentary document is kept by a law firm and the law firm is no longer at the location specified in the certificate and cannot otherwise be located, with the Law Society of British Columbia, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a result of that search,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the application is for a grant of probate, a grant of administration with will annexed, an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, one of the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: no testamentary document of the deceased that is dated later than the date of the will has been found;

one or more testamentary documents of the deceased dated later than the date of the will have been found, but, for the reasons stated in the affidavit, the applicant believes that those testamentary documents are invalid or otherwise not relevant to the application, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the application is for a grant of administration without will annexed, one of the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: no testamentary document of the deceased has been found;

one or more testamentary documents of the deceased have been found, but, for the reasons stated in the affidavit, the applicant believes that those testamentary documents are invalid or otherwise not relevant to the application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, under subrule (14) (a) (ii) or (b) (ii), the applicant has found one or more testamentary documents that the applicant believes are invalid or otherwise not relevant to the application, a copy of those testamentary documents must be attached as an exhibit to the affidavit.

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Applications Respecting Wills — Execution of Will

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Proof of proper execution of will by affidavit of subscribing witness
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application is brought under this rule for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the will contains no attestation clause, or

the will contains an attestation clause but that clause is not sufficient to show that the requirements of Division 1 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act relating to the execution of wills, or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, were met when the will was signed,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the applicant must do one of the following unless the will has been proved in solemn form:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file with the submission for estate grant an affidavit from at least one of the subscribing witnesses that the requirements of Division 1 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act relating to the execution of wills, or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, were met when the will was signed;
if an affidavit from a subscribing witness as required by paragraph (c) cannot be obtained, comply with subrule (16).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence of proper execution of will where subscribing witness unavailable
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an affidavit from a subscribing witness as required by subrule (15) (c) cannot be obtained,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant must, subject to paragraphs (b) and (c) of this subrule,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: swear or affirm in the affidavit referred to in subrule (2) (b) (i) (B) that the affidavit from a subscribing witness required by subrule (15) cannot be obtained, and

file an affidavit by any other person present when the will was signed that the requirements of Division 1 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act relating to the execution of wills, or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, were met,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if it is not possible to obtain an affidavit referred to in paragraph (a) (ii) of this subrule, the applicant must, subject to paragraph (c),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: swear or affirm in the affidavit referred to in subrule (2) (b) (i) (B) that neither an affidavit from a subscribing witness required by subrule (15) nor an affidavit required by paragraph (a) (ii) of this subrule can be obtained, and
file one or more affidavits, by one or more persons deposing from personal knowledge, which affidavits, collectively, provide that

bcl:clause.bcl:text: except in the case of a will signed by a person other than the will-maker in the manner referred to in subrule (18) (e), the signature of the will-maker on the will is in the handwriting of the deceased, and
the signatures of the subscribing witnesses on the will are in the handwriting of those witnesses, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if it is not possible to obtain an affidavit referred to in paragraph (a) (ii) of this subrule or an affidavit referred to in paragraph (b) (ii), the applicant must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: swear or affirm in the affidavit referred to in subrule (2) (b) (i) (B) that neither an affidavit from a subscribing witness required by subrule (15) nor the affidavits referred to in paragraphs (a) (ii) and (b) (ii) of this subrule can be obtained, and
file an affidavit, by a person deposing from personal knowledge, respecting circumstances that raise a presumption in favour of the proper execution of the will.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Proof of proper execution of privileged will by member of military force
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application is brought under this rule for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed and the applicant alleges that the will is made in a form permitted by section 38 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act for a will by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a member of the Canadian Forces while on active service under the National Defence Act (Canada), or
a member of a naval, land or air force of any member of the British Commonwealth of Nations or any ally of Canada while on active service,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the applicant must, unless the will has been proved in solemn form, provide evidence in the affidavit referred to in subrule (2) (b) (i) (B) that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the will-maker was authorized to make a will in that form at the time the will was made, and
the will was executed in accordance with the requirements of section 38 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Proof of will-maker's knowledge of will
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application is brought under this rule for a grant of probate, a grant of administration with will annexed, an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed and, at the time of the making of the will, the will-maker

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: was blind,
was illiterate,
did not fully understand the language in which the will was written,
signed the will by means of a mark instead of handwritten words, or
directed another person to sign the will on behalf of the will-maker in the will-maker's presence,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the applicant must, unless the will has been proved in solemn form,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: indicate in the affidavit referred to in subrule (2) (b) (i) (B) which of paragraphs (a) to (e) of this subrule apply, and

if the attestation clause of the will does not indicate that the circumstances referred to in the paragraphs identified under paragraph (f) of this subrule applied to the will-maker at the time of the signing of the will, file one or more affidavits, by any person deposing from personal knowledge, respecting circumstances that raise a presumption that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the requirements of Division 1 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, were met, and
the will-maker had knowledge of the contents of the will.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application is brought under this rule for a grant of probate, a grant of administration with will annexed, an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed in respect of a will that is in the form required by the Convention Providing a Uniform Law on the Form of an International Will enacted as Schedule 2 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, the applicant is not required to provide evidence of the authenticity of the signature of the authorized person, as that term is defined in the convention.

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Applications Respecting Wills — Appearance of Will

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an alteration that is not an erasure or obliteration appears in a will, the applicant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file an affidavit, which affidavit may but need not be in Form P16, by any person with personal knowledge of the facts, stating that the alteration was present when the will was signed, or
file evidence that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the alteration was made in accordance with the requirements of Divisions 1 and 4 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,
the alteration was authenticated by the re-execution of the will or by the subsequent execution of a codicil,
the alteration

bcl:clause.bcl:text: does not substantively alter the effect of the will, and
is in respect of form, style or numbering or is a typographical error, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the will was proved in solemn form, and the order proving the will in solemn form determined that the alteration does form part of the will.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If words in a will have been erased or obliterated, the applicant must, unless the words are entirely effaced and cannot be ascertained on inspection,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file an affidavit, which affidavit may but need not be in Form P16, by any person with personal knowledge of the facts, stating that the erasure or obliteration existed in the will when the will was signed, or
file evidence that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the erasure or obliteration was made in accordance with the requirements of Divisions 1 and 4 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,
the erasure or obliteration was authenticated by the re-execution of the will or by the subsequent execution of a codicil, or
the will was proved in solemn form and the order proving the will in solemn form determined that the words erased or obliterated do not form part of the will.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar must consider appearance of will
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Without limiting subrules (20) and (21), if an application is brought under this rule for a grant of probate, a grant of administration with will annexed, an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed and the appearance of the will leads the registrar to believe that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: words in the will were erased or obliterated,
an attempt was made to revoke the will,
a page or document was previously attached to the will but is missing,
the will is incomplete,

the will has been altered and the alteration is not one made by the will-maker in compliance with Divisions 1 and 4 of Part 4 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, or

the will does not comply with the requirements of section 37 (1) (b) of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act or the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the registrar may, unless the will has been proved in solemn form, require the applicant to file one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any page or document that was previously attached to, or is apparently missing from, the will;
an affidavit that explains

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the circumstances that led to the deficiency that the registrar perceives in the will, and
the will-maker's knowledge and intentions relative to those circumstances.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the electronic will filed by an applicant is alterable, the registrar may require the applicant to file an affidavit confirming that the electronic will was not altered before it was filed.

Without limiting subrule (22), if an application is brought under this rule in respect of a will for a grant of probate, a grant of administration with will annexed, an ancillary grant of probate or an ancillary grant of administration with will annexed, and if a reference in the will to a document raises a question as to whether the document ought to form part of the will, the registrar must require the applicant to file

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the document, or
if the applicant is unable or unwilling to file the required document, an affidavit explaining why the document is not being filed.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subrule (23) does not apply to a reference in a will to a document that sets out the allowance to be paid to an executor or administrator of the will.

If, in relation to an application for an estate grant, there is a question under subrule (20), (21), (22) or (23) about what is or is not included in the will, the registrar must refer the application, along with any materials filed with the registrar under the applicable subrule, to a judge or master for an order resolving that question.

An applicant may amend the whole or any part of an application for estate grant filed by the applicant at any time before the grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information has been issued.
Unless the court otherwise orders, to amend an application under subrule (1), an applicant must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: amend the application in accordance with subrule (3),
indicate on the amended application the date on which the original version of the application was filed,
if any changes are being made to the submission for estate grant, include an affidavit swearing the information in the amended submission for estate grant is correct, and
file the amended application and affidavit.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Unless the court otherwise orders, if an application is amended under this rule,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any deleted wording must be shown as struck out, and
any added wording must be underlined.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Withdrawal of application before issuance of grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: At any time before a grant is issued, an applicant may withdraw the applicant's application for estate grant by filing a notice of withdrawal in Form P44 and delivering a copy of the notice of withdrawal to every person who was entitled to notice under the original application.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Procedure After Filing Application Materials for Estate Grant

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (2), the registrar must do the following on an application for an estate grant:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application materials filed under Rule 25-3 do not include the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant required in relation to that application, issue to the applicant an authorization to obtain estate information in Form P18, to recognize the applicant as the person to whom an estate grant will be issued once the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant has been filed and all fees payable in relation to the application, including all probate fees, have been paid;

subject to section 124 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, after the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant required in relation to that application is filed with or after the filing of the other application materials filed under Rule 25-3, issue an estate grant in Form P19 once all fees payable in relation to that filing, including all applicable probate fees, have been paid.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An estate grant must have attached to it,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a physical will that was made when witnesses were physically present, a copy of the originally signed version of the will,

in the case of a physical will that was signed in counterparts when witnesses were electronically present, a copy of the counterpart signed by the will-maker and a copy of the last page of each counterpart that was signed by witnesses not physically in the presence of the will-maker, or
in the case of an electronic will, a physical copy of the originally signed version of the will.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: When registrar must refuse to approve application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The registrar must not issue an authorization to obtain estate information under subrule (1) (a) of this rule or an estate grant under subrule (1) (b) unless the registrar is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notice of the application has been delivered in accordance with Rule 25-2,
the application materials comply with Rule 25-3,

without limiting paragraph (b), if the application is for a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed and is supported by an affidavit in Form P3, it was appropriate for that form of affidavit to be filed in support of the application,
if the application is for an ancillary grant of probate or administration,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the information in the foreign grant respecting the name of the deceased and the other names by which the deceased was known exactly matches the information in the submission for estate grant respecting those names, and

each of the persons to whom the foreign grant was issued is an applicant in the submission for estate grant, and the names of the applicants in the submission for estate grant exactly match the names of the persons to whom the foreign grant was issued,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the document to be issued is an authorization to obtain estate information, the only document that remains to be filed is the affidavit of assets and liabilities for estate grant and the applicant requires the authorization to obtain estate information to facilitate the applicant's ability to determine the assets in the estate and the liabilities applicable to them,
if the document to be issued is an estate grant, all fees payable in relation to the application, including all probate fees, have been paid,
there is no notice of dispute in effect in relation to the estate, and
there is no reason to require a hearing in relation to the application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Application must be in relation to will
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the registrar is not satisfied that the making, revocation, alteration or revival of a testamentary document complies with the Wills, Estates and Succession Act or with the corresponding requirements of any law to which reference may be made under section 80 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, the registrar must not issue an authorization to obtain estate information under subrule (1) (a) of this rule or an estate grant under subrule (1) (b) until

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar is satisfied that the making, revocation, alteration or revival of the testamentary document complies with those requirements,
the court orders, under section 58 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, that the testamentary document is effective as a will, or
the court orders that the testamentary document is proved as a will in solemn form.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar must provide notice of refusal
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, under subrule (3), the registrar refuses to issue an estate grant or an authorization to obtain estate information, the registrar must provide to the applicant notice, in writing, of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any defect in the application materials, including, without limitation, in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the form of the application materials,
the information contained or not contained in the application materials, or
any exhibit or other document attached or not attached to, or filed or not filed with, the application materials,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other question or matter relating to the application that prevents the registrar from approving it, and

any further information or material that the registrar requires in order to be satisfied in relation to a matter of which he or she must be satisfied before issuing an estate grant or an authorization to obtain estate information.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How notice is to be provided
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The registrar may provide to the applicant the notice required under subrule (4) by any convenient means, including, without limitation, by sending the notice to the applicant at the mailing address, fax number or e-mail address, if any, provided as an address for service by the applicant in the submission for estate grant.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure after refusal by registrar to approve application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, on an application for an estate grant, the registrar refuses to issue an estate grant or an authorization to obtain estate information, the applicant may do one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file further information and material

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to correct a defect of which the applicant was informed under subrule (4) (a) or (b), or
required by the registrar under subrule (4) (c);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: proceed under Rule 25-9 to request an order of the court.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Subrules (1) to (6) applicable after filing of revised or additional material
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subrules (1) to (6) of this rule apply to a reconsideration by the registrar of an application after revised or additional material is filed under subrule (6) (a).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Application by one or more of several co-executors
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A grant of probate issued on an application for an estate grant brought by one or more, but not all, co-executors must reserve the right of a co-executor who does not join in the application to apply at a later time unless that co-executor has renounced executorship.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Corrections, Amendments and Revocations of Estate Documents

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the person to whom an estate grant is issued or on whose behalf a foreign grant is resealed, or who was issued an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information, determines that there is a clerical mistake, or an error arising from an accidental slip or omission, in the estate grant, resealed foreign grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information, the person may apply to the registrar to correct the estate grant, resealed foreign grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote:
Application to correct name of deceased
in style of proceeding
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Without limiting subrule (1), a person who has applied for an estate grant or to reseal a foreign grant may request that the registrar correct the deceased's name in the style of proceeding of the grant or authorization by complying with Rule 23-1 (9) and filing an affidavit explaining the error and indicating the deceased's correct name.

If, on an application under subrule (1) respecting an estate grant, a resealed foreign grant, an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information, the registrar is satisfied that a clerical mistake or an error has occurred in the estate grant, resealed foreign grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information, the registrar may correct the clerical mistake or error by issuing to the applicant a correction record in Form P20.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote:
Registrar may correct name of deceased
in style of proceeding
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, before the issuance of a grant or authorization or the resealing of a foreign grant,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an applicant makes a request under subrule (1.1), and

the registrar is satisfied that the deceased's name is incorrectly set out in the style of proceeding of the instrument referred to in the request and that the deceased's name is correctly set out elsewhere in the submission for estate grant in Form P2 or the submission for resealing in Form P21 and that the deceased's name in the notice in Form P1 is not seriously misleading,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the registrar must issue a Form P20.1 and, when issuing the grant or authorization or resealing the foreign grant, may use the corrected name in the style of proceeding.

On application, the court may order that an authorization to obtain estate information, an authorization to obtain resealing information, an estate grant or the resealing of a foreign grant be amended and,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person applying for the amendment is the person to whom the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information was issued or on whose application the foreign grant was resealed, that person must provide to the registry the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant, along with all certified and notarial copies of it, concurrently with the filing of the application record provided under Rule 8-1 (15), or

if the person applying for the amendment is not the person to whom the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information was issued or on whose application the foreign grant was resealed,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that person must, without limiting Rule 8-1, ensure that the person who has possession or control of the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant is served with the notice of application and supporting materials, and

the person who has possession or control of the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant must file the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant no later than 4 p.m. on the business day that is one full business day before the date set for the hearing.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a document is amended under subrule (3), the amended document replaces the original document and, unless the court otherwise orders, that original document and the certified and notarial copies provided to the registry under subrule (3) are not to be returned to any person.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of grant in revocation application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: On application, the court may order that an estate grant, an authorization to obtain estate information, an authorization to obtain resealing information or the resealing of a foreign grant be revoked and,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person applying for revocation is the person to whom the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information was issued or on whose application the foreign grant was resealed, that person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: must provide to the registry the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant, along with all certified and notarial copies of it, concurrently with the filing of the notice of application, and

after complying with subparagraph (i), must not act under the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant without leave of the registrar until the application is decided, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person applying for revocation is not the person to whom the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information was issued or on whose application the foreign grant was resealed,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person who has possession or control of the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant must file the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant within 7 days after being served with the notice of application for the revocation, and

after being served with the notice of application, the person to whom the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant was issued must not act under the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information, authorization to obtain resealing information or resealed foreign grant without leave of the registrar until the application is decided.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The registrar may grant leave to a person under subrule (5) (a) (ii) or (b) (ii) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a request for leave is made by filing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a requisition in Form 19.1, and
affidavit or other evidence in support of the request, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar is satisfied that the harm that will occur if the leave is granted is less than the harm that will occur if leave is not granted.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A default in the filing of an application response or, if the court orders service and filing of pleadings in an application under Rule 25-14 (1) (c), in the filing of a response to civil claim, does not, of itself, justify an order revoking the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information or revoking the resealing of the foreign grant.
In this rule, foreign will, in relation to an application under subrule (2), means the will in relation to which the foreign grant referred to in that subrule was issued.

If a grant of probate or equivalent, or a grant of administration or equivalent, was issued in a jurisdiction prescribed for the purposes of section 138 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, the foreign personal representative to whom the foreign grant was issued may, after the documents referred to in Rule 25-2 (1) have been delivered in accordance with Rule 25-2, apply for a resealing of the foreign grant by filing the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a submission for resealing in Form P21;

a copy of the foreign grant that has been certified by the issuing court, and, if the foreign will is not attached to the foreign grant, a copy of the foreign will that has been certified by the issuing court;
an affidavit from the applicant or, if there are 2 or more applicants, from at least one of the applicants, as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the application is for resealing a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed, in Form P22;
if the application is for resealing a grant of administration without will annexed, in Form P23;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if there are 2 or more foreign personal representatives to whom the foreign grant was issued, an affidavit in Form P24 from each of the foreign personal representatives who has not sworn an affidavit referred to in paragraph (c);
2 copies of a certificate from the chief executive officer under the Vital Statistics Act indicating the results of a search for a wills notice filed by or on behalf of the deceased;

one or more affidavits, in Form P9, that, collectively, confirm that the documents referred to in Rule 25-2 were delivered to all of the persons to whom, under that rule, the documents were required to be delivered;

in accordance with subrule (6) of this rule, an affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing in Form P25 from the applicant, or, if there is more than one applicant, from at least one of the applicants;
in accordance with subrule (8), for each of the documents that are filed with the submission for resealing and that are not written in the English language, an affidavit of translator in Form P12.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If there are 2 or more foreign personal representatives to whom the foreign grant was issued, all of those foreign personal representatives must be applicants in the application for resealing and those applicants

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must adopt a single address for service that is applicable to them all, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and
may adopt additional addresses for service under Rule 4-1 (2) provided that each additional address for service is applicable to all of the applicants.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the submission for resealing referred to in subrule (2) (a) specifies a different ordinary residence for the deceased at the time of his or her death than does the foreign grant, the registrar may require further evidence as to the domicile of the deceased.
None of the documents referred to in a paragraph of subrule (2) may be attached to any document referred to in any other paragraph of subrule (2).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An affidavit required under subrule (2) (g) may be filed concurrently with or subsequent to the filing of the other documents referred to in subrule (2).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Whether or not a foreign grant has been resealed in response to an application under subrule (2), if the applicant determines, after filing the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing required in relation to the application, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: there are assets or liabilities of the estate that are neither referred to in that affidavit nor referred to in an affidavit filed under this subrule, or

information contained in the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing, or in a supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing filed under this subrule, is incorrect or incomplete,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the applicant must file a supplemental affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing in Form P26 promptly after making that determination and must pay all fees payable in relation to that filing, including all applicable probate fees.
An affidavit of translator in Form P12 must be filed concurrently with any document referred to in subrule (2) that is the subject of a translation.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Delivery to Public Guardian and Trustee
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (10) of this rule, if, under Rule 25-2, the applicant was required to deliver to the Public Guardian and Trustee the documents referred to in Rule 25-2 (1), the applicant must, promptly after filing a document referred to in subrule (2) of this rule, deliver a copy of that filed document to the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Exceptions to delivery to Public Guardian and Trustee
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An applicant referred to in subrule (9) need not, under that subrule, deliver to the Public Guardian and Trustee the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of any document filed under subrule (2) (b) if a copy of that document was delivered to the Public Guardian and Trustee under Rule 25-2;
the exhibit to the affidavits of delivery filed under subrule (2) (f) of this rule;
any affidavit of delivery filed under subrule (2) (f) that relates solely to delivery of the notice of proposed application to the Public Guardian and Trustee.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The applicant in an application brought under this rule must swear or affirm in the affidavit required under subrule (2) (c) that the applicant is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a diligent search for a testamentary document of the deceased has been made in each place that could reasonably be considered to be a place where a testamentary document may be found, including, without limitation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in all places where the deceased usually kept important documents, and
on electronic devices or in third-party electronic repositories used by the deceased, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as a result of that search,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the foreign grant is a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed, one of the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: no testamentary document of the deceased that is dated later than the date of the foreign will has been found;

one or more testamentary documents of the deceased dated later than the date of the foreign will have been found, and the reasons why the applicant believes that those testamentary documents are invalid or otherwise not relevant to the application, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the foreign grant is a grant of administration without will annexed, one of the following:

bcl:clause.bcl:text: no testamentary document of the deceased has been found;

one or more testamentary documents of the deceased have been found, and the reasons why the applicant believes that those testamentary documents are invalid or otherwise not relevant to the application.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Procedure After Filing Application Materials for Resealing

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (3), the registrar must, on an application to reseal a foreign grant, do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application materials filed under Rule 25-6 do not include the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing required in relation to that application, issue to the applicant an authorization to obtain resealing information in Form P27 to recognize the applicant as the person to whom a resealed grant will be issued once

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing has been filed, and
all fees payable in relation to that filing, including all applicable probate fees, have been paid;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to section 124 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act, if the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing required in relation to the application is filed with or after the filing of the other application materials filed under Rule 25-6, reseal the foreign grant once all fees payable in relation to the application, including all applicable probate fees, have been paid.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: To reseal a foreign grant, the registrar must attach a Form P28 to the certified copy of the foreign grant that was filed under Rule 25-6 (2) (b).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: When registrar must refuse to approve application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The registrar must not issue an authorization to obtain resealing information under subrule (1) (a) of this rule or reseal a foreign grant under subrule (1) (b) unless the registrar is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notice of the application had been delivered in accordance with Rule 25-2,
the application materials comply with Rule 25-6,

the information in the foreign grant respecting the name of the deceased and the other names by which the deceased was known exactly matches the information in the submission for resealing respecting those names,

each of the persons to whom the foreign grant was issued is an applicant in the submission for resealing, and the names of the applicants in the submission for resealing exactly match the names of the persons to whom the foreign grant was issued,

if the document to be issued is an authorization to obtain resealing information, the only document that remains to be filed is the affidavit of assets and liabilities for resealing and the applicant requires the authorization to obtain resealing information to facilitate the applicant's ability to determine the assets in the estate and the liabilities applicable to them,
if the registrar intends to reseal the foreign grant, all fees payable in relation to the application have been paid,
there is no notice of dispute in effect in relation to the estate, and
there is no reason to require a hearing in relation to the application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar must provide notice of refusal
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, under subrule (3), the registrar refuses to approve an application for the resealing of a foreign grant, the registrar must provide to the applicant notice, in writing, of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any defect in the application materials, including, without limitation, in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the form of the application materials,
the information contained or not contained in the application materials, or
any exhibit or other document attached or not attached to, or filed or not filed with, the application materials,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other question or matter relating to the application that prevents the registrar from approving it, and
any further information or material that the registrar requires in order to be satisfied in relation to a matter of which he or she must be satisfied before resealing the foreign grant.
