bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How notice is to be provided
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The registrar may provide to the applicant the notice required under subrule (4) by any convenient means, including, without limitation, by sending it to the applicant at the mailing address, fax number or e-mail address, if any, provided as an address for service by the applicant in the submission for resealing.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Procedure after refusal by registrar to approve application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, on an application for the resealing of a foreign grant, the registrar refuses to issue an authorization to obtain resealing information or to reseal a foreign grant, the applicant may do one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: file further information and material

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to correct a defect of which the applicant was informed under subrule (4) (a) or (b), or
required by the registrar under subrule (4) (c);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: proceed under Rule 25-9 to request a hearing by the court.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Subrules (1) to (6) applicable after filing of revised or additional material
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subrules (1) to (6) of this rule apply to a reconsideration by the registrar of an application after revised or additional material is filed under subrule (6) (a).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Notice to issuing court of resealing
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: After the resealing of a foreign grant, the registrar must provide notice of the resealing to the court that issued the foreign grant.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of revocation or amendment of resealed grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the registrar knows that a British Columbia grant has been resealed in another jurisdiction, the registrar must notify the resealing court of any revocation or amendment of the British Columbia grant.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Effect of Authorization to Obtain Estate Information or Authorization to Obtain Resealing Information

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An applicant to whom an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information has been issued may deliver a copy of that authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any person whom the applicant believes has possession or control of one or more assets of the estate of the deceased;
any person whom the applicant believes has possession or control of one or more documents relating to assets of the estate of the deceased.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person to whom a copy of an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information is delivered under subrule (1) must, within 30 days after the date of delivery,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deliver to the applicant information as to the nature and value of those assets of the deceased's estate that are in the person's possession or control, or
if the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has possession or control of a safety deposit box, a safe, a storage locker or any other thing or place where the deceased kept or may have kept records or assets, and
does not have a document that itemizes the contents of that thing or place,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: allow the holder of the authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information to have access to that thing or place for the purposes of listing its contents.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Powers of court if information or access not provided
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a person to whom a copy of an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information is delivered under subrule (1) does not comply with subrule (2), the applicant may, on notice to the person, apply to the court for an order that the required information or access be provided, and the court may, on the application,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make an order that the information or access be provided in the manner and at the time or within the period ordered by the court, and
make such other orders as the court considers will further the objects of these Supreme Court Civil Rules, including, without limitation, an order that the person pay the costs of the application.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Application to Court for Grant or Resealing

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If the registrar refuses to issue an estate grant, an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information or refuses to reseal a foreign grant, the applicant may apply to the court for the authorization, grant or resealing.
An applicant wishing to apply to the court under subrule (1) must file

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a requisition in Form 31,
a draft of the proposed order in Form 35,
affidavit or other evidence in support of the application, and
any material provided by the registrar in relation to the application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An application under subrule (1) in relation to a will is not in the nature of an appeal from the registrar and, on that application, the court may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the application,
direct that an application be made for the will to be proved in solemn form, or
direct that the application be heard by the court and give directions respecting that hearing.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar to issue authorization or grant following disposition of application
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If an application under subrule (1) is approved by the court under subrule (3) (a) or at a hearing referred to in subrule (3) (c), the registrar must issue the estate grant, authorization to obtain estate information or authorization to obtain resealing information or reseal the foreign grant, as the case may be, in accordance with the order.

To oppose the issuance of an estate grant, an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information or to oppose the resealing of a foreign grant, a person to whom documents have been or are to be delivered under Rule 25-2 (2) or a person who claims an interest under a prior or subsequent will must file a notice of dispute that accords with subrule (3) of this rule before the earlier of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the issuance of an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information, and
the issuance of an estate grant or the resealing of a foreign grant.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Only one notice of dispute to be filed
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person must not file more than one notice of dispute in relation to any one estate.

A notice of dispute referred to in subrule (1) must be in Form P29, must provide an address for service of the disputant, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and must disclose

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the disputant is a person to whom documents have been or are to be delivered under Rule 25-2 (2) or a person who claims an interest under a prior or subsequent will, and
the grounds on which the notice of dispute is filed.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A notice of dispute may be amended once without leave of the court, and after that only with leave of the court.

Rule 6-1 (2) and (3) applies to an amendment of a notice of dispute without leave of the court and, for that purpose, a reference in that rule to a pleading is deemed to be a reference to the notice of dispute.
The court may renew a notice of dispute, for any period the court considers appropriate, as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application for renewal is brought before the notice of dispute ceases to be in effect, if the court is satisfied that it is appropriate to make an order for renewal;
if the application for renewal is brought after the notice of dispute ceases to be in effect, if the court is satisfied that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: there were good reasons that the application for renewal could not be brought before the notice of dispute ceases to be in effect,
substantial prejudice would be suffered by the person seeking renewal of the notice of dispute if the order for renewal is not made, and
no other person interested in the estate would suffer substantial prejudice if the order for renewal is made.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Application for renewal of notice of dispute
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to Rule 8-5 (6), an application to renew a notice of dispute filed in relation to an estate must be made on notice to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each person who has submitted for filing a submission for estate grant, or a submission for resealing, in relation to the estate,
each person who has filed a notice of dispute in relation to the estate, and
any other interested person to whom the court directs notice be given.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: No grant while notice of dispute in effect
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: While a notice of dispute is in effect in relation to the estate of a deceased, the registrar must not, with respect to that estate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: issue an estate grant, an authorization to obtain estate information or an authorization to obtain resealing information, or
reseal a foreign grant.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A disputant may withdraw a notice of dispute by filing a withdrawal of notice of dispute in Form P30.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Application to remove notice of dispute
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person who is interested in an estate in relation to which a notice of dispute has been filed, including, without limitation, an applicant for an estate grant or for the resealing of a foreign grant, may apply on notice to the disputant for an order removing the notice of dispute.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Grounds on which notice of dispute may be removed
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: On an application under subrule (10), the court may, by order in Form P31, remove a notice of dispute if the court determines that the filing is not in the best interests of the estate.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: When notice of dispute ceases to be in effect
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A notice of dispute in relation to an estate ceases to be in effect as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraph (b), on the date that is one year after the date on which the notice of dispute was filed;
if the notice of dispute has been renewed under subrule (6), at the end of the renewal period;
if the notice of dispute is withdrawn by the disputant under subrule (9);
if the will in relation to which the notice of dispute relates is proved in solemn form;
if the court orders, under subrule (11) or otherwise, that the notice of dispute is removed.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a testamentary document is or may be in existence, a person interested in the estate may serve by personal service on each person named as an executor in the testamentary document a citation in Form P32 in respect of the testamentary document to require the served person to apply for a grant of probate in relation to that testamentary document.
A citation under subrule (1) in relation to a grant of probate

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be served by personal service on each alternate executor if an event, including, without limitation, an event referred to in subrule (5), occurs that entitles the alternate executor to assume the office of executor, and
must not be served on an alternate executor until an event referred to in paragraph (a) occurs that entitles that alternate executor to assume the office of executor.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A citation under subrule (1) in relation to a testamentary document must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an address for service of the citor, which address for service must be an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and
a statement of the citor providing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the grounds for the citor's knowledge of or belief as to the existence of the testamentary document, and
information available to the citor that will allow the testamentary document to be identified.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person who is cited by being served with a citation under subrule (1) must, within 14 days after being served with the citation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the cited person has been issued a grant of probate in respect of the testamentary document in relation to which the citation was issued, serve on the citor, by ordinary service, a copy of the estate grant, or
if the cited person has not yet been issued a grant of probate in respect of the testamentary document in relation to which the citation was issued, serve the citor as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if the cited person has filed a submission for estate grant under Rule 25-3 (2) in respect of the testamentary document, serve on the citor, by ordinary service, a copy of the filed submission for estate grant along with copies of the other documents filed under Rule 25-3 (2);

if subparagraph (i) does not apply but the cited person has delivered documents under Rule 25-2 (1) in relation to an application for a grant of probate that the cited person intends to pursue in respect of the testamentary document, serve on the citor, by ordinary service, a copy of those documents;

if the cited person has not taken any step under this Part in relation to the estate, serve on the citor, by ordinary service, an answer in Form P33 providing an address for service that is an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1) and stating that the cited person

bcl:clause.bcl:text: will apply for a grant of probate in respect of the testamentary document, or
refuses to apply for a grant of probate in respect of the testamentary document.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person who is cited under subrule (1) to apply for a grant of probate in relation to a testamentary document is deemed to have renounced executorship in relation to that testamentary document if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: he or she is a person referred to in subrule (4) (b) (i), (ii) or (iii) (A) and does not

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: serve on the citor the document that, under that provision, he or she is required to serve, or
obtain a grant of probate within 6 months after the date on which the citation was served or within any longer period that the court on the application of the cited person may allow, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: he or she is a person who serves on the citor an answer referred to in subrule (4) (b) (iii) (B).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Effect of failure to answer citation or give reason for refusing probate
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If each person who is cited under subrule (1) to apply for a grant of probate in relation to a testamentary document is deemed under subrule (5) to have renounced executorship in relation to the testamentary document, the citor or another person interested in the estate may, without limiting any other right the citor or other person may have, apply for one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a grant of probate or a grant of administration with will annexed in relation to the testamentary document or another testamentary document;
an order under section 58 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act curing any deficiencies in the testamentary document;
an order that the testamentary document is a will proved in solemn form;
if the testamentary document is in the possession of a cited person, the issuance of a subpoena under Rule 25-12 to require the cited person to file the testamentary document.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Affidavit of deemed renunciation for grant of probate
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: The citor may swear an affidavit of deemed renunciation in Form P34 if the person who has been served with a citation in respect of a testamentary document is deemed under subrule (5) to have renounced executorship in relation to the testamentary document.

bcl:rule.bcl:text: Subpoena for Testamentary Document or Grant

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How to obtain a subpoena for testamentary document or grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A person may apply for a subpoena to be issued to require a person to deliver to the registry one or more of a testamentary document, an authorization to obtain estate information, an authorization to obtain resealing information, an estate grant, a foreign grant, a resealed foreign grant and a certified or notarial copy of such a document.
An application may be brought under subrule (1) by filing

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a requisition for subpoena in Form P35 that provides for the applicant an address for service that is an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1), and
an affidavit in support of the request.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: On being satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the document in relation to which the subpoena is sought is required for the purpose of any application or other matter under this Part, and
the person to whom the subpoena is addressed failed to comply with a request of the applicant to provide the document to the applicant,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the registrar may issue the subpoena, in Form P37, sought by the application.

A subpoena issued under this rule must be personally served and, if an affidavit is filed for the purpose of proving the service, the affidavit must state when, where, how and by whom service was effected.

The registrar may endorse a copy of the requisition for subpoena in Form P35 with a notation that the person to whom the subpoena was directed has not, within a specified period, done either of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delivered to the registry the document referred to in the subpoena;

provided to the registrar an affidavit indicating that the document referred to in the subpoena is not in the person's possession or control and setting out what knowledge the person has respecting that document.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Failure of subpoenaed person to file document
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: On receipt of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: proof that a subpoena was served on a person (the "served person"),
proof that the delivery of the documents required by the subpoena is required for the purpose of any application or other matter under this Part, and
a copy of the requisition for subpoena in Form P35 that has been endorsed by the registrar in accordance with subrule (5),

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: the court, by its warrant in Form P36 directed to a peace officer, may cause the served person to be apprehended and promptly brought before the court and to be detained in custody or released on terms the court may order, and the court may order the served person to pay the costs arising from his or her failure to file the document.
The court may, by release order in Form 117, order the release of a person apprehended under subrule (6) on receiving an undertaking in Form 116 from that person.

A person who has been served with a subpoena under this rule may apply to the court for an order setting aside the subpoena on the grounds that compliance with it is unnecessary or that it would work a hardship on the person, and the court may make any order it considers will further the object of these Supreme Court Civil Rules.
A personal representative or a person interested in an estate administered by a personal representative may apply, in accordance with subrule (2), for an order for one or both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order for the passing of the personal representative's accounts in relation to the estate;
an order to fix and approve the personal representative's remuneration.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An application under subrule (1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be brought

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with Rule 25-14 (1) (o), (p) or (q),
in conjunction with an application referred to in Rule 25-14 (1) (d), (e) or (f), or
in accordance with Rule 8-3 if each interested person other than the applicant has consented to the accounts to be passed or the remuneration to be fixed and approved, as the case may be, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must, if brought by the personal representative, be supported by an affidavit in support of application to pass accounts in Form P38.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: In an application under subrule (1), the court may do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: hear and decide any matter relating to the accounts or the remuneration of the personal representative;
direct the registrar to conduct an inquiry, assessment or accounting in relation to any matter relating to the accounts or the remuneration of the personal representative;
make any other order or give any direction that the court considers appropriate in the circumstances.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (5), after a direction is made under subrule (3) (b), Rule 18-1 applies as if the application and the direction had been made under Rule 18-1.
Unless the court otherwise orders, if the court directs the registrar to conduct an inquiry, assessment or accounting under subrule (3) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar must, by certificate in Form P39, certify the result of the inquiry, assessment or accounting, and
if filed under Rule 18-1 (9), the certificate is binding, subject to appeal, on the persons interested in the estate who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: had notice of the inquiry, assessment or accounting,
consented to the accounts or the remuneration, or
are the subject of an order made under Rule 18-1 (20) (b).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Affidavit required for passing of accounts and remuneration
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: In addition to any other materials that may be required for an application under subrule (1) of this rule, the applicant must file the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the applicant is the personal representative, he or she must file a statement of account affidavit in Form P40

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: describing the assets and liabilities of the estate as at the later of

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the date of the deceased's death, and
the last day of the period covered by the most recent of the accounts passed under this Part or approved and consented to in writing by all beneficiaries,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: describing, in chronological order, capital transactions that occurred after the applicable date referred to in subparagraph (i),
describing, in chronological order, income transactions that occurred after the applicable date referred to in subparagraph (i),
describing the assets and liabilities of the estate as at the last day of the period covered by the accounts to be passed,
describing all distributions made and any distributions anticipated to be made out of the estate,
including a calculation of the remuneration, if any, claimed by the applicant for

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the applicant, and
any current and previous personal representative or trustee for whom a claim for remuneration has not yet been made, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: including any other details or information the court may require or the applicant may consider relevant;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the applicant is a person other than the personal representative, he or she must file an affidavit explaining why an accounting is required.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Unless the court on an application otherwise orders, if costs are payable under an application under subrule (1), those costs

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be assessed as special costs, and
may be assessed without an order of the court,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: and Rule 14-1 (3) and (5) applies.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How to apply for most applications
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If there has been an application for estate grant, a person may apply in accordance with Part 8 for an order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 115/2019, s. 8 (b).]
granting administration with or without will annexed in circumstances in which the right to be appointed as the administrator is contested,
revoking an authorization to obtain estate information or estate grant or an authorization to obtain resealing information or the resealing of a foreign grant,

subject to subrule (1.2), removing or substituting a personal representative or, if different, the holder of an authorization to obtain estate information or the holder of an authorization to obtain resealing information,
discharging a personal representative or, if different, the holder of an authorization to obtain estate information or the holder of an authorization to obtain resealing information,
passing over an executor,
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 103/2015, s. 7 (a) (iii).]
removing or renewing a notice of dispute,
that a foreign grant of probate or administration not be resealed,
requiring security for the administration of an estate,
varying or substituting security for the administration of an estate,
directing that security be assigned to a person named in the order,
respecting production, delivery or filing of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a testamentary document,
a certified or notarial copy of an authorization to obtain estate information,
an estate grant,
an authorization to obtain resealing information, or
a resealed foreign grant,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 44/2014, Sch. 1, s. 12 (c).]
for the passing of accounts,
fixing and approving the remuneration of a personal representative,
subject to subrule (2), respecting any other matter concerning

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an authorization to obtain estate information,
an authorization to obtain resealing information,
a grant of probate,
a grant of administration with or without will annexed,
an ancillary grant,
a resealing, or
the office of personal representative,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: other than a question or matter covered by Rule 2-1 (2) (c) or (d),
appointing a trustee to hold and administer a minor's interest in an estate until the minor reaches 19 years of age,
waiving an obligation under Rule 25-3 (14) to search an electronic device if the person does not have access to it, or
allowing a person to apply to amend an application in a manner other than as set out in Rule 25-3.1.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How to apply by petition for orders
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If there has been no application for estate grant, a person may, with notice, apply by petition to the court for an order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: passing over an executor,
appointing an administrator of the estate under section 132 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act,
respecting production, delivery or filing of a testamentary document, and
subject to subrule (2), respecting any other matter referred to in subrule (1).

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If there has been an application for estate grant, a person may apply in accordance with Part 8, or, if nothing has been filed in relation to the estate, by requisition in Form P41, for an order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: under Rule 25-2 (14), or
to shorten the 21-day waiting period referred to in Rule in 25-2 (1) or to authorize a filing made before that period has expired.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Substitution of personal representative in the event of death
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a deceased's personal representative dies, a person may apply in accordance with Part 8, subject to any directions given by the court under subrule (8) of this rule, to be substituted as the personal representative by filing

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of the death certificate of the personal representative,

an affidavit setting out the request to be substituted as the personal representative and specifying the right to be appointed as personal representative on the basis that the person is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the alternate executor;
entitled to apply for administration of the estate in accordance with section 130 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act;
entitled to apply for administration with will annexed in accordance with section 131 of that Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an affidavit confirming delivery of the affidavit referred to in paragraph (b) to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: every person who was entitled to notice under the original application, and
any executors who

bcl:clause.bcl:text: did not receive notice of the original application, and
have an equal or greater right to apply to be the personal representative.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: How to apply for spousal home and will deficiencies orders
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: To apply to the court for any of the following orders:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order under section 30 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act determining the value of a deceased's interest in a spousal home within the meaning of that Act;
an order under section 33 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act relating to a spousal home within the meaning of that Act;
an order under section 58 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act respecting deficiencies in a document that does or may disclose a testamentary intention or testamentary disposition of a deceased;
an order under section 59 of the Wills, Estates and Succession Act rectifying a will,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may, if there is an existing proceeding within which, under these Supreme Court Civil Rules, it is appropriate to seek that order, apply for that order in accordance with Part 8 by notice of application in Form P42 in that proceeding, or
must, if there is no existing proceeding within which it is appropriate to seek that order, apply by petition in Form P43.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: An applicant who makes an application under subrule (1.11) by filing a requisition in Form P41 must include an address for service that is an accessible address that complies with Rule 4-1 (1).

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Proceeding for proof of a will in solemn form
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: To apply to the court for an order proving a will in solemn form, a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may, if there is an existing proceeding within which, under these Supreme Court Civil Rules, it is appropriate to seek that order, apply for that order by notice of application in that proceeding, or
must, if there is no existing proceeding within which it is appropriate to seek that order, start a proceeding by petition under Rule 16-1 and seek the order within that proceeding.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Subject to subrule (6) of this rule, a person applying to the court under any of paragraphs (b) to (q) of subrule (1) must, unless Rule 17-1 applies or the court otherwise orders, serve the notice of application and the other application materials referred to in Rule 8-1 (7) on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each personal representative of the deceased unless that personal representative is the applicant, and
any other person who may be affected by the order sought.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A notice of application in an application referred to in paragraph (c), (d), (e) or (f) of subrule (1) of this rule must be personally served on a personal representative or, in the case of a reference in subrule (1) (f) to a person with a right to administration in priority to the applicant, that person.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Disputant to receive notice of proceeding relating to a grant
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: While a notice of dispute is in effect in relation to the estate of a deceased, a person who, in relation to that estate, brings any application under this rule must, without limiting any other service obligations applicable to the person, serve on the disputant, by ordinary service, a copy of all documents the applicant is required to file in connection with the application.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Court may give directions as to procedure
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Without limiting any other power of the court under this or any other Part of these Supreme Court Civil Rules, the court may, on its own motion or on application, give directions concerning the procedure to be followed in any matter under this Part and, without limiting this, may give directions respecting any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the issues to be decided;
who the parties will be, including directions for the addition or substitution of a party;
how evidence may or must be presented;
summary disposition of any or all issues in the matter;
the trial of any or all of the issues in the matter;
pleadings;
examinations for discovery and discovery of documents;
service or delivery of a notice, process, order or document on any person;
dispensing with service or delivery;
representation of any person or interest.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Rule 16-1 applies to all applications by petition under this rule.

If the individual who would be entitled to be a personal representative of an estate is a minor, the court may, with the consent of the Public Guardian and Trustee, make a grant of administration, for the minor's use and benefit, to the guardian who has, in relation to the minor, the parental responsibilities referred to in section 41 (k) of the Family Law Act.
Rule 4-1 (3) applies to this Part and, for that purpose,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reference in Rule 4-1 (3) to a party of record who has provided an address for service is deemed to refer in this Part to a person who has provided, by service, delivery or otherwise, a document under this Part in which the person has included an address for service, and

a reference in Rule 4-1 (3) to other parties of record is deemed to be a reference to any other person to whom the person referred to in paragraph (a) provided the document referred to in that paragraph.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: If no address for service given
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: Rule 4-2 (7) applies to this Part and, for that purpose, a reference in Rule 4-2 (7) to a party of record is deemed to refer in this Part to a person who has delivered, served or otherwise provided a document under this Part in which the person ought to have included an address for service.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Costs if only solemn form required
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: A respondent to a petition or application brought under this Part is not liable for costs if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the respondent merely requires that the will be proved in solemn form, and
the respondent only intends to cross-examine the witnesses produced in support of the will,

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: unless the court determines that there was no reasonable ground for requiring proof in solemn form.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Costs for accessing electronic will in third-party electronic repository
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a recipient of a notice of proposed application in relation to an estate is required to incur expenses in order to access a third-party electronic repository for the purpose of viewing an electronic will, the person applying for the estate grant must reimburse the recipient of the notice for those expenses.
In this rule, former rule means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Rule 61 or Rule 62 of the Supreme Court Rules, B.C. Reg. 221/90, that was repealed on the coming into force of the Supreme Court Civil Rules, B.C. Reg. 168/2009, or
Rule 21-4 or Rule 21-5 that was repealed on the coming into force of this rule.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Application for grant or resealing under former rule
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If, before the coming into force of this rule, an application was brought under a former rule for a grant of probate or administration, ancillary grant of probate or administration or resealing of a foreign grant,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the application is deemed to be an application for an estate grant or a resealing, as the case may be, under this Part,
if that application met all of the notice, delivery and service requirements of the former rule, it is deemed to meet all of the notice, delivery and service requirements of this Part, and

the court or the registrar may issue an estate grant or reseal a foreign grant, as the case may be, in response to the application if that estate grant could have been issued, or that foreign grant could have been resealed, under the former rule.

bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a caveat filed under a former rule in relation to an estate is in effect on the coming into force of this rule, the caveat

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is deemed to be a notice of dispute filed under this Part, and
expires

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: when it is withdrawn,
if it is not withdrawn but has been renewed by order of the court, when the renewal period ceases, or
if it is not withdrawn and has not been renewed by order of the court, on the date that is 6 months after the date on which it was filed.

bcl:subrule.bcl:marginalnote: Citation to accept or refuse probate served under former rule
bcl:subrule.bcl:text: If a citation to accept or refuse probate or to propound an alleged will was served under a former rule, the citation is deemed to be a citation under Rule 25-11, and, for that purpose, the citation is deemed to have been served on the coming into force of this rule.

A probate action brought under a former rule, or a petition proceeding brought under a former rule for proof of a will in solemn form, that was ongoing when this rule came into effect is deemed to continue as a proceeding under this Part and, for that purpose, all steps that could have been taken in the probate action or petition proceeding under the former rule, including, without limitation, steps in respect of pleadings, examinations for discovery, discovery of documents and the trial of any or all issues, may be taken in the proceeding under this Part subject to any contrary directions under subrule (6).
The court may give directions if there is any dispute in relation to the procedure to be applied to, or followed in, a proceeding referred to in this Part.
